subject: send string containing lexical representation of xsd:base64Binary as parameter
msgSnippet: Hi All, I have came cross one problem. How to resolve solution. Any one knows about the followings. 1.What is meant by A string containing lexical
messageBody:
Hi All,


I have came cross one problem. How to resolve
solution. Any one knows about the followings.

1.What is meant by "A string containing lexical
representation of xsd:base64Binary".
2 to send string containing lexical representation of
xsd:base64Binary as parameter.How can we achieve
this??

Javax.xml.bind.DataConverterType
parseBase64Binary
public static byte[]
parseBase64Binary(java.lang.String
lexicalXSDBase64Binary)
Converts the string argument into an array of bytes.
Parameters:
lexicalXSDBase64Binary - A string containing lexical
representation of xsd:base64Binary.
Returns:
An array of bytes represented by the string argument.

Java Code:

The Execute method for Base64Decoding Class
import sun.misc.BASE64Decoder;
import javax.xml.bind.*;
import com.sun.xml.bind.*;
import java.io.IOException;
//
.......
///
public Object execute(String[] params){
try{
if(validateParameters(params)){
BASE64Decoder base64 = new BASE64Decoder();
String str2 = new
String(base64.decodeBuffer(params[0]));
try{
DatatypeConverterInterface dconv =
DatatypeConverterImpl.theInstance;
DatatypeConverter.setDatatypeConverter(DatatypeConverterImpl.theInstance);
byte[] bytes;
String str=DatatypeConverter.printBoolean(false);
System.out.println(str);
byte [] by
=DatatypeConverter.parseBase64Binary("params[0]");
// In the above line of code null is returned into
'by'.As per the documentation of parseBase64Binary we
have
// to send string containing lexical representation of
xsd:base64Binary as parameter.How can we achieve
this??
}catch(Exception e){e.printStackTrace();}
return new String(base64.decodeBuffer(params[0]));
}
else
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Decoding takes at
least the Source String");
}catch(IOException ioe){
throw new com.visa.esp.fa.control.FAException("Error
in decoding");
}
}
....................
.....................
//
}
The JUnit Test case for the execute method of the
Base64Decoding Class:
public void testExecute(){
String nullParams[] = null;
String params1[] = {null};
String [] actualParams={"decodableString"};
try{
assertNotNull(testClass.execute(nullParams));
fail();
}catch(IllegalArgumentException iae){}
try{
assertNotNull(testClass.execute(params1));
fail();
}catch(IllegalArgumentException iae){}
assertNotNull(testClass.execute(actualParams));
}
Give me the solution for Java code and JUnit code for
send string containing lexical representation of
xsd:base64Binary as parameter.How can we achieve
this??

I will appreciate ur help.
Cheers,
Kavita
